law.catch_line: Council for Community Education -- Membership -- Bylaws -- Officers -- Meetings -- Reimbursement of expenses.

text.section: A state Council for Community Education shall be established for the purpose of advising the commissioner of education and the Department of Education on issues relating to community education programs and making recommendations for the funding of local community education programs.

The commissioner of education or the commissioner's designee shall convene the first meeting of the council for the purpose of establishing the bylaws of the council and electing officers to include: chairman, vice chairman, and secretary.
The council shall not meet more than four (4) times annually. Members may be reimbursed for expenses but shall not receive a per diem allowance.

law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 428, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1998.
